activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 215, Branch 2

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad A. Miller

records.addlTxt:
**BOND APPLICABLE TO BOTH 22CF205 & 22CF206**

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Cases 22CF205 & 22CF206 called @ 1:28 PM: Defendant Chad A. Miller appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by phone for Chad A. Miller. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. As to both matters: Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. Advised of right of Counsel. DE's eligibility for SPD services has not yet been determined. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $1000 cash bond applicable to 22CF205 & 22CF206. IA Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Initial appearance on November 30, 2022 at 11:45 am.
